press.subtitle: Download logos, grab brand colors, and reference usage guidelines.

about.title: About Bonfire
about.body: {brandName} is a Czech game dev community that runs meetups in {prague} and {zlin}. Bonfire curates talks, panels, and networking nights connecting professionals, students, and indie creators. Bonfire is powered by volunteers and partners who believe in sharing craft and building a welcoming scene.

logos.title: Logo Downloads
logos.subtitle: Use the right logo for light or dark backgrounds and download in PNG or SVG.
logos.preferenceNote: We prefer the gradient versions whenever possible. If your design does not allow it, use the non-gradient logo.
logos.downloadAllSubtitle: Get every logo variant in one zip.

guidelines.title: Usage Guidelines
guidelines.subtitle: Keep the Bonfire mark clean and consistent.
guidelines.do1: Use the full logo with generous clear space around it.
guidelines.do2: Choose black or gray logos on light backgrounds and white on dark.
guidelines.do3: Keep the logo proportions and colors intact.
guidelines.dont1: Stretch, crop, rotate, or add effects to the logo.
guidelines.dont2: Place the logo on busy photography or low-contrast backgrounds.
guidelines.dont3: Recolor or rebuild the logo with different typefaces.

brandName.title: Brand Name
brandName.subtitle: Keep the name clear and consistent in editorial text.
brandName.do2: Shorten to ‚ÄúBonfire‚Äù after the first mention.
brandName.dont1: Use just ‚ÄúBonfire‚Äù as the first mention.
brandName.dont3: Add extra descriptors like ‚ÄúBonfire meetup group‚Äù.

teamPage.title: Meet the beautiful chaos crew
teamPage.subtitle: We run meetups, wrangle cables, and keep the vibes sharp in {prague} and {zlin}.
introLines: No capes. Just checklists, coffee, and a stubborn love for game dev.
If something goes right, it was planned. If something goes wrong, it was still planned.
We are allergic to boring events. We bring the spark.
teamPage.joinCallout: Want to lend a hand? Reach out at
teamPage.founderNote: Bonfire exists because of **you** - the crew, the speakers, and everyone who shows up. Building a strong community, connecting people, and sharing knowledge is what this is all about. Thank **you** for being part of it.

footer.vibes: Casual meetups, big ideas, and good vibes. üî•üéÆ

legal.title: Legal & Code of Conduct
legal.subtitle: Ensuring a safe and welcoming space for all.
legal.intro: Bonfire is a community built on respect. We are dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.

scope.title: Scope
scope.content: This Code of Conduct applies to all Bonfire spaces, including our in-person meetups, online communities (Discord, social media), and any related events or gatherings. It applies to all participants, including attendees, speakers, sponsors, volunteers, and organizers.

community.title: Our Values
community.content: Our events are open to anyone interested in game development. We strive to create an inviting, friendly, and respectful environment where professionals, students, and hobbyists can connect. We encourage participants to assume good intent, be patient with newcomers, and offer constructive feedback rather than criticism. We expect all participants to be professional, considerate, and respectful of fellow attendees' boundaries and perspectives.

rules.title: Prohibited Conduct
rules.content:
The following behaviors are strictly prohibited at all Bonfire events and spaces:

<bullet><bold>Verbal Harassment</bold>: Offensive comments related to gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, age, race, ethnicity, nationality, or religion. This includes slurs, insults, and unwelcome comments about someone's identity or appearance.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Physical Harassment</bold>: Unwanted physical contact, blocking someone's path, or invading personal space. Always ask before initiating physical contact such as handshakes or hugs.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Sexual Harassment</bold>: Unwelcome sexual attention, inappropriate imagery, sexualized comments or jokes, and unwanted advances.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Intimidation & Stalking</bold>: Threatening behavior, following someone without consent, or persistent unwanted contact both during and after events.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Online Harassment</bold>: Harassing behavior in our Discord server, social media, or any digital communication related to Bonfire.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Disruption</bold>: Sustained disruption of talks, presentations, or other activities.</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Privacy Violations</bold>: Recording or photographing individuals without consent, or sharing private conversations.</bullet>

consequences.title: Consequences
consequences.content:
Participants asked to stop any harassing or inappropriate behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in prohibited conduct, event organizers may take any action they deem appropriate, including:

<bullet>A verbal warning</bullet>
<bullet>Removal from the event or online space without refund</bullet>
<bullet>A ban from future Bonfire events</bullet>
<bullet>Reporting to local authorities when applicable</bullet>

Event organizers retain sole discretion in determining the appropriate response to any situation.

photos.title: Media Policy
photos.content: We love capturing the energy of our community! By attending our events, you agree that your image may be used in our social media, website, or marketing materials. We respect your privacy. If you would prefer not to be photographed, please inform our staff at check-in. If you would like a specific photo of yourself removed from our platforms, contact us and we will accommodate your request.

contact.title: Reporting & Support
contact.content: If you experience or witness a breach of this code of conduct, please report it immediately. All reports will be handled with discretion and confidentiality. You can reach our team by:
contact.methods:
<bullet>Speaking directly to any Bonfire staff member at the event (they will be clearly identifiable)</bullet>
<bullet>Emailing us (reports are monitored before, during, and after events)</bullet>
contact.closing: We take all reports seriously and are committed to addressing concerns promptly. You will not face retaliation for making a good-faith report.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This Privacy Policy explains how Bonfire Events collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our website and services.

controller.title: Data Controller
controller.content: Bonfire Events is the data controller for your personal data. If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us at hello@bnf.events.

personal.title: Personal Data
personal.content:
We collect the following personal data:

<bullet><bold>Account Information</bold>: Email address (required for account creation)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Form Submissions</bold>: Name, email, and message content when you submit contact forms or talk proposals</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Authentication Data</bold>: Login attempts, authentication challenges, and access tokens</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Preferences</bold>: Email communication preferences</bullet>

technical.title: Technical Data
technical.content:
We automatically collect:

<bullet><bold>IP Addresses</bold>: Hashed for security and rate limiting purposes</bullet>
<bullet><bold>User Agent Strings</bold>: Hashed for security and analytics</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Usage Data</bold>: Page views, interactions, and performance metrics</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Cookies</bold>: Essential cookies for CSRF protection, locale preferences, and theme settings</bullet>

interactions.title: User Interactions
interactions.content:
We store:

<bullet><bold>Video Likes</bold>: Based on hashed IP and user agent (no account required)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Video Boosts</bold>: Linked to your user account</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Login History</bold>: Authentication attempts and outcomes for security purposes</bullet>

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.content: We use your email address to send one-time verification codes for secure, passwordless login. Authentication data is used to verify your identity and protect your account.

communication.title: Communication
communication.content: We use your email address to respond to your inquiries, send account-related notifications, and (with your consent) send community updates about Bonfire events.

analytics.title: Analytics & Performance
analytics.content: We use anonymized usage data to understand how our website is used, improve performance, and enhance user experience.

security.title: Security
security.content: We use IP addresses, user agent strings, and login attempt data to detect and prevent abuse, spam, and unauthorized access.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content:
We process your personal data based on:

<bullet><bold>Consent</bold>: Email preferences, form submissions, and account creation</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Legitimate Interest</bold>: Security, fraud prevention, and website analytics</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Contract</bold>: Providing authentication and account services</bullet>

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing & Third-Party Services
dataSharing.content:
We use the following third-party services that may process your data:

<bullet><bold>Vercel</bold>: Hosting, analytics, and performance monitoring. Privacy policy: https://vercel.com/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Resend</bold>: Email delivery service for OTP codes and notifications. Privacy policy: https://resend.com/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Cloudflare Turnstile</bold>: Bot detection and spam prevention. Privacy policy: https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Neon Database</bold>: Database hosting for user data and form submissions. Privacy policy: https://neon.tech/legal/privacy-policy</bullet>

We do not sell your personal data. We only share data with service providers necessary to operate our website and services.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage & Retention
dataStorage.location: Your data is stored in databases hosted by Neon. We use service providers that comply with GDPR requirements.

retention.title: Retention Periods
retention.content:
We retain your data for the following periods:

<bullet><bold>Account Data</bold>: Until you delete your account or request deletion</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Form Submissions</bold>: Until you request deletion or for up to 2 years</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Login Attempts</bold>: 30 days for security audit purposes</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Authentication Challenges</bold>: Until used or expired (typically 10 minutes)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Video Interactions</bold>: Until you delete your account (for boosts) or indefinitely (for likes, as they're anonymized)</bullet>

yourRights.title: Your Rights (GDPR)
yourRights.content:
Under GDPR, you have the following rights:

<bullet><bold>Right to Access</bold>: You can view your account data on the /me page</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Rectification</bold>: You can update your email preferences in your account settings</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Erasure</bold>: You can delete your account at any time from the /me page</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Data Portability</bold>: Contact us to request a copy of your data</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Object</bold>: You can opt out of community emails in your preferences</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Right to Withdraw Consent</bold>: You can withdraw consent for email communications at any time</bullet>

To exercise these rights, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use the contact form.

cookies.title: Cookies & Tracking
cookies.content:
We use the following cookies:

<bullet><bold>Essential Cookies</bold>: bnf_csrf (CSRF protection), NEXT_LOCALE (language preference), bonfire-theme (theme preference)</bullet>
<bullet><bold>Analytics</bold>: Vercel Analytics collects anonymized usage data</bullet>

You can manage cookies through your browser settings. Essential cookies are required for the website to function properly.

security.title: Security
security.content:
We implement security measures to protect your data:

<bullet>Passwordless authentication with time-limited OTP codes</bullet>
<bullet>IP addresses and user agent strings are hashed before storage</bullet>
<bullet>HTTPS encryption for all data transmission</bullet>
<bullet>Rate limiting to prevent abuse</bullet>
<bullet>Regular security audits and updates</bullet>

internationalTransfers.title: International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.content: Your data may be processed by service providers located outside the European Economic Area (EEA). We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, including GDPR-compliant data processing agreements with all service providers.

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our services are not directed to individuals under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe we have collected information from a child, please contact us immediately.

changes.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of significant changes by updating the "Last updated" date at the top of this policy. Continued use of our services after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contactPrivacy.title: Contact Us About Privacy
contactPrivacy.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use our contact form.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.intro: By accessing and using the Bonfire Events website and services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By creating an account, submitting forms, or using our website, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, please do not use our services.

service.title: Description of Service
service.content: Bonfire Events provides a platform for game development community meetups, including event information, video recordings, and community features. We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue any aspect of the service at any time.

accounts.title: Account Registration
accounts.content:
To use certain features, you must create an account:

<bullet>You must provide a valid email address</bullet>
<bullet>You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account</bullet>
<bullet>You must be at least 16 years old to create an account</bullet>
<bullet>You agree to provide accurate and complete information</bullet>
<bullet>You are responsible for all activities under your account</bullet>

userConduct.title: User Conduct
userConduct.content:
You agree to:

<bullet>Use the service only for lawful purposes</bullet>
<bullet>Not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any part of the service</bullet>
<bullet>Not interfere with or disrupt the service or servers</bullet>
<bullet>Not use automated systems to access the service without permission</bullet>
<bullet>Comply with our Code of Conduct</bullet>
<bullet>Not submit false, misleading, or harmful content</bullet>

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: The website content, including text, graphics, logos, and software, is owned by Bonfire Events or its licensors and is protected by copyright and trademark laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without permission. For logo and brand usage, see our Press Kit page.

userContent.title: User-Generated Content
userContent.content: By submitting content (forms, proposals, comments), you grant Bonfire Events a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, modify, and display your content for the purpose of operating and promoting our services.

availability.title: Service Availability
availability.content: We strive to provide reliable service but do not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free operation. We reserve the right to perform maintenance, updates, or modifications that may temporarily affect service availability.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Bonfire Events shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the service. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid to us (if any) in the past 12 months.

indemnification.title: Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify and hold harmless Bonfire Events from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from your use of the service, violation of these terms, or infringement of any rights of another party.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: We may suspend or terminate your account at any time for violation of these terms or our Code of Conduct. You may delete your account at any time from your account settings.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Service are governed by the laws of the Czech Republic. Any disputes shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the Czech Republic.

disputes.title: Dispute Resolution
disputes.content: If you have a dispute, please contact us first at hello@bnf.events. We will attempt to resolve disputes amicably. If a resolution cannot be reached, disputes will be resolved through the courts of the Czech Republic.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of significant changes. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

contactTerms.title: Contact Us
contactTerms.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, contact us at hello@bnf.events or use our contact form.

contactPage.subtitle: Questions, feedback, partnership inquiries, or just want to say hi? Drop us a message and we'll get back to you.

form.title: Send a Message
form.subtitle: Fill out the form below and we'll respond soon.
form.name: Your Name
form.subject: Subject
form.messagePlaceholder: Tell us what's on your mind...
form.successMessage: Thanks for reaching out. We'll get back to you as soon as possible.
form.draftNote: Drafts are stored locally in your browser. If you don't submit, your data never reaches us.

errors.messageRequired: Please enter a message (at least 10 characters)
errors.rateLimited: You've sent too many messages. Please try again later.
errors.botBlocked: We couldn't verify this request. Please try again.

errors.generic: Something went wrong. Please try again or email us directly.

talkProposalPage.subtitle: We're always looking for passionate speakers to share their expertise with our community. Whether you're a seasoned pro or first-time speaker, we want to hear from you.
talkProposalPage.questions: Have questions about speaking? Email us at

whatWeLookFor.title: What We Look For
whatWeLookFor.item1: Game development topics: programming, art, design, audio, production, business
whatWeLookFor.item4: Passion for sharing knowledge with the community

form.title: Submit Your Proposal
form.subtitle: Tell us about your talk idea.
form.talkTitlePlaceholder: A catchy title for your talk
form.abstractPlaceholder: Describe what your talk is about, what attendees will learn, and why it's relevant to game developers...
form.abstractHint: Minimum 50 characters. Be specific about the value for attendees.
form.experiencePlaceholder: Tell us about your background and any previous speaking experience...
form.successMessage: Thanks for your submission! We'll review your proposal and get back to you within a few weeks.
form.draftNote: Drafts are stored locally in your browser. If you don't submit, your data never reaches us.

errors.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
errors.titleRequired: Please enter a talk title (at least 5 characters)
errors.abstractRequired: Please provide an abstract (at least 50 characters)

accountDelete.ignore: If you have questions or need help, contact us at hello@bnf.events
accountDelete.securityTip: Only enter this code if you requested account deletion. This action cannot be undone.

authLogin.title: Sign in to Bonfire
authLogin.subtitle: We will send a one-time code to confirm your address.
authLogin.secureBody: We'll send a code to your email. Quick, simple, and secure.
authLogin.codeHint: Enter the 6-digit code we sent to your inbox.
authLogin.boostHint: Boosting is for members. Sign in to boost this video.

authLogin.errorRateLimited: Too many attempts. Try again shortly.
authLogin.errorTooManyAttempts: Too many attempts. Request a new code.

delete.intentRequired: Please confirm you want to delete your account immediately.
delete.sendIntro: Click send to email your confirmation code.
delete.completed: Deletion completed. Redirecting you to the homepage.
delete.error: Unable to start deletion. Please try again.
delete.expired: Code expired. Request a new one.
delete.tooManyAttempts: Too many attempts. Request a new code.

attempts.title: Recent login attempts
attempts.empty: No login attempts in the last 30 days.
